conbody.p: A privilege set or scope specifies the access for users to the applications in the Plant Applications Universal Client. For each application in the Plant Applications Universal Client, by default, a privilege set is available in the application.

A privilege set contains the following components:
Privilege Set: A parent object which denotes a specific application in the Plant Applications Universal Client. You can use it to provide access to the groups and the users associated with the groups to an application.
Group: A collection of users and groups. You can add a group in the Security Management application to link it to a group with the same name in the supported identity provider applications. You can then assign this group to any number of applications in the Plant Applications Universal Client.
User: An individual member registered with a supported identity provider. A user can be a member of any number of groups.

example.title: User allocation in the Security Management application
example.p: Suppose a user, TherouC, is assigned to two groups, a_PPC_EPI_PA_SIS_AUG_SAPDeliv and a_PPC_EPI_PA_SIS_AUG_SAPPrOrd, in an identity provider application. If a_PPC_EPI_PA_SIS_AUG_SAPDeliv is added to the NCM Management privilege set and a_PPC_EPI_PA_SIS_AUG_SAPPrOrd is added to the Route Management privilege set, TherouC will have access to both NCM Management and Route Management applications.
